page.title: 17LINCOLNSHIRE LIFE:POETRY
page.content: { Come along with me and hold my hand, { To walk along quiet lanes, {With fields of corn on either side; { Lanes across which rabbits bolt, { And Pheasants dart from hedges; {Where Hedgehogs creep across the road { To bury in dry hay. * {Down in the hollow of the misty Wolds { Where the lost flowers grow, { And people live to stay, { There you will find { A forgotten state of life { To live today. { }* { For the Pheasants roost { And the Partridges wander; { The Rabbits play at night in the moonlight. { The Owls hoot and the mice hide, { The Moles work. {There is no loneliness in this Peace.}
